subject: Re: JUnit 4 causes an error when exception is expected
msgSnippet: ... That is the trace from the Statistics window of the JUnit Test Results. The output window which contains the stack trace printed from the catch block of my
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Ilja Preuss <it@...> wrote:
> I don't see a BatchUpdateException being thrown in that stack trace.

That is the trace from the Statistics window of the JUnit Test
Results. The output window which contains the stack trace printed
from the catch block of my method contains the following:

com.tester.someClass insertValues

(APPDB.TABLEA_R01) violated - parent key not found

> When the test passes when you remove the expected declaration, that
> means that no exception was thrown at all.
>
The test passes but the same stack trace as above is present in the
output window of the JUnit Test Results.

I'm wondering if this is happening because the method that generates
the exception also catches it and hence JUnit can't find the
exception?
